talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter: I think more people should read Rorty's Achieving Our Country, especially his frank assessment of LBJ in it; it's a good perspective

talk.author: did:plc:krape6kqv6jib3kaqskf7w2x
talk.utter: Yeah, I ran out of room. Meant to say LBJ except Vietnam. But that’s a big exception. So is Gaza.

talk.author: did:plc:krape6kqv6jib3kaqskf7w2x
talk.utter: So do you agree Marshall has a point?

talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter: No! Of course not! Marshall's point is not that Biden has done bad things too or Democrats will do bad things too. It's not even that there's no difference between them and the GOP (which is completely wrong, and probably something he thinks). It's that if Biden wins somehow the GOP will still win

talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter: No! Of course not! Marshall's point is not that Biden has done bad things too or Democrats will do bad things too. It's not even that there's no difference between them and the GOP (which is completely wrong, and probably something he thinks). It's that if Biden wins somehow the GOP will still win

talk.author: did:plc:krape6kqv6jib3kaqskf7w2x
talk.utter: But they are winning when Biden capitulates. We saw this with Obama too.

talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter: Biden capitulates (some things) because they already did win: the House. An unfortunately unavoidable component of the legislative process. The whole point is that we do not want them to win control of things, such as the House, the Senate, or the White House.

talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter:
I also went to a state school
but it's a bit funny to mention in this context, given that that state school was GMU

talk.author: did:plc:nvfposmpmhegtyvhbs75s3pw
talk.utter: yeah i was going to say that after state school i have to whisper “it was uva”

talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter: It was actually pretty funny growing up in VA which was so red at the time when I was a kid but had this tradition of supporting actually very good state schools (GMU econ and law are what they are but the undergrad is a perfectly adequate state school, and it's the third tier in VA)

talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter: It was actually pretty funny growing up in VA which was so red at the time when I was a kid but had this tradition of supporting actually very good state schools (GMU econ and law are what they are but the undergrad is a perfectly adequate state school, and it's the third tier in VA)

talk.author: did:plc:msauhqa34ckvoct4rsdoijsy
talk.utter: My dad taught there for 30 years. I have a great affection for the place

talk.author: did:plc:r75unbj372lvbim6syioaueo
talk.utter: My dad was there when they desegregated; the student protesters seized control of a building and physically confronted the administration. That is admittedly a much more cool thing than ever happened while I was there (we went to the Final Four, that was OK I guess)
